lines.text: The baby's crying.
Of course he's crying. Will you put that floor lamp over here!
But it won't reach.
Certainly it won't reach. You have to pull the plug out of the socket. Here
[hands him baby's milk bottle]
[immediately starts drinking from it]

[grabs the cord and literally yanks it so hard that the socket casing comes out of the wall. A wierd noise is heard and a second later the socket casing hits him in the nose!]
Ooooh!
[startled spits out the milk he was drinking. The door phone starts ringing]

[while making his way to the phone]
Will you see if you can keep that baby quiet.
[answers the phone]
Hello?
[one-second pause]
How do you expect us to keep this baby quiet with you ringing the phone!
[slams the reciver down so hard, that the phone nearly comes off the wall]
Well, I'll be seeing you.
Where are you going?
Just going down...
Well you can't leave me alone here with this child.
Why?
Why? Well you're just as much responsible for it as I am.
What have I got to do with it?

What have you got to do with it? What have YOU got to do with it? Why you were the one who wanted me to have a baby, and now that you've gotten me into this trouble, you want to walk out and leave me flat.
But I don't know anything about babies.
Well you should have thought of that before we got it.
I don't wanna get mixed up in this thing. I've got my future, my career to think of.
Your career. What about me? What will my friends say? Why I'll be ostricized.
Well I'm going to lose my hook, like and sinker.
So, you're going to desert me, just when I need you most.
[Stan heads for the door, Ollie runs and beats him to it]
You're not leaving this room.
I'm not as dumb as you look.
What are you putting that cotton in your ears for?
If I make a noise, I won't be able to hear it.
What did you strike that match for?
I wanted to see if the light switch was off.
You woke the baby up.
